Posts.Content: I have my first mammogram on 6th November, in the letter that came I was told that I would then be examined and the results of the scan would be reported immediately by a specialist breast care nurse. Great care in my part of the U.K. Katie
Posts.Title: Annual mammogram - how long for result

Posts.Content: I think you should go back to your doctor.  I had a mammogram and an ultra sound and everything seemed to be clear.  The consultant then did an aspiration in the area and it was only then that something showed up. Fingers crossed there is nothing there but better to be sure. Katie
Posts.Title: Advice after mammogram

Posts.Content: Very glad for you. Katie x
Posts.Title: Advice after mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi JMC04, I haven't yet got the voucher for the wig but the Macmillan nurse told me of  a place locally where I could go and have a look and they would sort the voucher out with the hospital.  Perhaps I wasn't in the right frame of mind but I was a bit disappointed.  I seem to be running out of time now so I think I'll try and get one after the mastectomy and before the chemo starts. For anyone living in the Stoke/Stafford area  you might be interested to know that there is a new beauty salon at The Stafford and The Stoke hospitals catering exclusively for cancer patients called 'Fresh Hair'.  I spoke to a lovely girl at Stoke and she said they had hundreds of wigs to try.  Unfortunately they can't at the moment accept vouchers from outside their area (which I am) but she said I could buy one privately from them or if I found one I liked she would give me the details and I could try and get it locally so I could use the voucher. She stressed that they are a non profit making business just set up to help people like us. I can't believe all the travelling you are going to have to do to get treatment - poor you. I shall think of you. Katie x
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed - any advice please?

Posts.Content: I've just been diagnosed with breast cancer.  I'm to have a mastectomy, Herceptin and chemotherapy.  Has anyone any tips that might help me through this?   The mastectomy doesn't bother me as much as the chemotherapy.  I survived Anal Cancer thirteen years ago and can't quite believe I have to battle again.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed - any advice please?

Posts.Content: Thank you for your welcome! My surgery is booked for a week on Monday - the 21st, I'm seeing the consultant again this Tuesday so perhaps I will know more then.  He did say that chemo would start 3 - 4 weeks after surgery but I don't know how Xmas will impact on that.  I have a grade 3 tumour so I'm anxious to start chemo asap. I remember that my taste buds went awry last time (I particularly didn't like the taste of wine,which was very sad!). I've made an appointment to look at wigs next week - I didn't lose my hair last time but I know this is going to be a much longer course of chemo so expecting the worst!
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed - any advice please?

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone for your hints and tips. JMC04 - Apparently the hospital will give me a voucher to get a wig!  I've got an appointment to go tomorrow to have a look so I can decide on what I want before I start treatment.  I'm concerned about Christmas too - in a way hoping they will start the chemo before, because the sooner the better as far as I'm concerned, however from past experience I don't imagine they will start until after but on the other hand I want Christmas with my grandchildren. Having the mastectomy on Monday and hoping all will be well to go to my grandaughter's nativity play on the 6th of December,  I'm determined to get there with all drains clanking if necessary!!   XXX
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed - any advice please?

Posts.Content: If you found one at Trendco that you like, look on their website and see what range of colours they do.  YOu can order on line but they won't take your NHS voucher. Katie
Posts.Title: Where to buy wig? Feeling desperate and dishartened

Posts.Content: Hi, Try Trendco in Manchester.  Unfortunately they won't accept the NHS vouchers but they are very good.  I've had three from there.  They also have a website where you can have a look/buy various styles but I would advise going in yourself as I found wigs I thought would suit me didn't, when I actually tried them on. Katie x
Posts.Title: Can anybody recommend wigs in Manchester

Posts.Content: I've recommended the 'chicken fillet' in an earlier post - just search on Ebay or I was told today they sell them at Primark! Just cut off the side you don't need (wasteful I know, but they're not expensive) and pop it into the pocket of your mastectomy bra (or pocket in your normal bra).  Lightweight and you really can't tell one side from t'other!
Posts.Title: Bras and prostheses for tiny boobs

Posts.Content: I'm on weekly paclitaxel for 12 weeks plus Herceptin every three weeks for a year.  I'm on number 10 next week. Apart from my hair falling out (I didn't bother with the cold cap and I've got a great wig) I haven't really had any side effects.  I feel a bit weary this week and I have a skin rash  - mainly on one arm - which comes and goes.  By all accounts weekly is easier to manage than three weekly.   I've had gel nails the whole time and my nails are o.k.  I've had no side effects from the Herceptin and there's no problem with the injection. I had a mastectomy before I started the chemo so hopefully all will finish in a couple of weeks time. Katie
Posts.Title: Weekly Paciltaxel

Posts.Content: I've used fake tan on my face for years and it didn't occur to me to stop when I had chemo!
Posts.Title: Can you use fake tan on head while on chemo? :0)

Posts.Content: I had a left sided mastectomy without reconstruction at the end of November and have only worn a bra once since.  This is fine whilst I can get away with baggy jumpers and scarves but isn't going to do come T shirt weather! The prosthesis feels like I'm carting around a very heavy potato and the bras are so hideously huge with really wide straps.  I'm on a mission to find something light and nice to wear! Katie
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Bras!
